images.description: This was just a handful of minor tweaks. Biggest change was expanding the hair so he didn't just have this giant bald spot on the back lol. This was also my last avatar before I came out as transgender.

This was among my first attempts at making a new icon to go with my new goat fursona. While I was here, I wanted to experiment with a slight artstyle change, since I wasn't too enamored by the whole gradient idea from many past avatars. I was initially experimenting with an really basic outline as a way to make this show up a bit easier on grey backgrounds (i.e, Discord), but I ended up ditching the whole transparent icon idea altogether and just went with a solid, bright background. Not only did it compliment the new artstyle, it also generally works way better across different contexts, like jpegs.

The final version of my birdsona avatar. After removing the odd "rotated" effect, and removing a bit of hair down by the neck, this avatar finally felt complete. Really, I can't think of anything I'd change, even to this day... apart from, y'know. The completely different 'sona.
The biggest change here from the previous was the improved colors, leaning more into the warm temperatures. Strangely appropriate.

At this point, I'd been using the birdsona avatar for roughly half a year. I eventually realized I was unhappy with how the original one looked, especially considering how many people seemed to get confused as to what it was actually supposed to be. So, I remade it largely from scratch, and after many, MANY revisions, this was the first version of the new avatar that I felt was good enough to use more permanently... despite the many, many problems I now see in it all these years later.

The very first (public) version of my birdsona avatar, which came about after I'd been using a cropped version of an old drawing of Piemations' Pretzel as an avatar for a while. I was obsessed with that bird character, it was cute as hell. So I finally decided to try making my own birdsona, which lead to the creation of this. That said, I hadn't actually came up with much of a design beyond what was seen in this icon. I guess I figured I'd sort that out later.

An updated version of my asterisk icon, in which I began implementing these abstract/geometric design ideas that I was a bit obsessed with at the time. This is also the first time I started used this strong orange colorscheme.

Welcome, curious traveler, to the very first icon I ever used! ...Under this name, anyway. This one was incredibly simple. For context, my username at this time was "jackasterisk", which came about as an amalgamation of several previous pseudonyms I had during my younger years. I thought it was pretty clever since the first part of it kinda sounds like "jackass". I'm not sure how many people actually got the joke, but I still thought it was funny lol.
